duties_responsibilities.duty: Safely switch railcars and ensure safe movement of trains.
Obtain and act on oral or written instructions via various communication devices.
Operate track switches and derails to change train routing within yards or on the road.
Inspect equipment and monitor track conditions to ensure safety and compliance with regulations.
Work in extreme all-weather conditions, safety-sensitive environments, and perform duties on and around heavy machinery.
Report on the performance of train operations and observe passing train conditions.

education_certification.credential: At least 18 years of age, or will be by the start date listed above.
Ability to report for duty at the designated work location.
Ability to work safely in the specified working conditions.
Ability to work the specified shifts/hours.
Ability to meet the specified travel requirements.
Ability to read, write, and communicate in English.
Ability to visually distinguish colors and sounds, and perform various physical activities.
Training for this position is company-paid on-the-job and classroom training for up to 17 weeks may include travel to BNSF's Training Center in Norman, OK.
SMART-TD or BLET Dues required per union agreement.
Transfer eligibility varies by location and may require up to 3 years’ employment and General Manager approval.
Pre-employment background verification, medical review, and drug screening required.
TWIC is a condition of employment for positions requiring unescorted access to secure areas of port facilities.
BNSF Railway is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
